title: (x) Very thin sans "Susan" - Penumbra Sans {Stephen}
content:
Please help. I thought I had a match with Penumbra Sans Std-light but it was just off a bit. Can you help ID this please. Thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122041816im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/susan_6199.gif)

 [‹ (x) Ulrike Krages classic serif caps - Trajan {Marc O}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122041816/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47958 "Go to previous forum topic") [Simple sans ID ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122041816/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47942 "Go to next forum topic")
author: tob

comments.content: I think [Penumbra Sans Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122041816/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/penumbra_sans_std_light/?sample_text=SUSAN&sample_size=96) is still correct. The sample may have deteriorated the stroke width, or this may be an instance of the older [Multiple Master](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122041816/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Multiple%252BMaster) version of the font.

I second what Stephen says. If you overlay Penumbra on your image the character shapes are almost a perfect match. Obviously the kerning needs to be matched and the quality of your scan makes the actual weight of the font difficult to work out. But this is definitely Penumbra Sans.
